item.title: Broken Glass in Play area, 28th June
item.description:
There is shattered pieces of glass in the children's play area. There are quite a few pieces.

item.title: Flipping green waste, 28th June
item.description:
Someone left bin bags with foliage Infront of property. The garden waste collection won't pick it up. The address is 28 Hayne Road, BR3 4JA

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayne Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Food bank rubbish left behind as usual, 28th June
item.description:
“Our Forgotten Neighbours” not taking their rubbish with them - yet again. Abandoned food rotting in this heat and encouraging more dumped rubbish. Islington Council really need to start fining these people

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seven Sisters Road, Stroud Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signs have been moved., 28th June
item.description:
There has been gas works at the end of road laying new pipelines on South borough lane and partially on Salisbury road. There was a notice on end of Salisbury road that said road ahead closed. There is a hole in this road and it had barriers around it but someone has moved them. 2 roads barriers have been moved - End of Salisbury Road and Turpington Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Turpington Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Half a dozen passage lights not working....., 28th June
item.description:
The passageways leading to Monument station are very dark, at least 6 lights are not working (with 5 in a row out) and the remaining ‘working’ lights are so filled with soot they look like they’ve never been cleaned and give out less than half the light they should. I took the photos on a sunny day, so it was quite bright, but at night time the passageways are so poorly lit they feel unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24-28, King William Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row
